text:
Hallo lads, I am having trouble `using` a package I am developing, perhaps because I deinstalled Python but is required for `SymPy` (?)
`LoadError: ArgumentError: Path to conda environment is not valid: C:\Users\myusername\.julia\conda\3`

elements.text: Hallo lads, I am having trouble
a package I am developing, perhaps because I deinstalled Python but is required for
LoadError: ArgumentError: Path to conda environment is not valid: C:\Users\myusername\.julia\conda\3

text:
You will find it impossible to run Python unless you have Python installed.
SymPy.jl is a wrapper written in Julia that wraps the Python software "sympy".
To use the underlying "sympy", Julia reaches Python with somethings  for it to do.
No Python? Nothing to reach.  Nothing reached? Nothing to be done.

text: Thanks <@U68QW0PUZ> It puzzles me because I have Python 2.4 actually installed. Could it be it needs Python 3.x or Anaconda?
